bio:treatment.description: Trees to 15m in native stands (to 23m in sheltered sites); mature crown of sheltered trees narrower than tree height, fairly open in natural sites. Seed cones mostly broadly ovoid, as broad as long or longer, mostly less than 13.5cm; umbos mostly shorter than 6mm, terminal portion curved outward. Seeds to 12mm wide, averaging less than 11mm, light to medium brown with dark mottling. 2 n =24.

statement.text: Dry fogbelt zone on eroding, mostly dry slopes;

character.name: habitat
character.value: dry fogbelt zone on eroding , dry slopes

bio:treatment.discussion: Pinus torreyana subsp. torreyana occurs naturally only in a relict stand near Del Mar, California.
